description: Change of use of two ground floor retail (A1) units to Betting office (A2) use (DUPLICATE APPLICATION)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Any interval commerical plant and building services plant associated with the commerical parts of the premises which is audible in dwellings within the same building shall be designed to satisfy an accoustic standard not exceeding Norh 23 ( Leg 5 mins) 23-00 0700hrs (Bedrooms) and HR 30 (Leg 1hour) 0700 hrs - 2300 hrs (Living Rooms.  REASON:To protect the living condition (of neighbouring occupiers) | Details to demonstrate that any audible outside the premises (including extract ducting) will be designed to satisfy an accoustic standard met exceeding HR35 Leg (5 mins 2300 -0700hrs and Hr 40 Leg (1hr) 0700-2300 ameasured or calcuated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises, shall be submitted to and approve in writing by the local planning auttion such details as approved shall be implemented and thereafter retained.  REASONS: To protect the living condition of neighbouring occupier (noise levels) . | Suitable and sufficient acoustic separation to at least that specified in the 1992 Edition of the Approved Document E of the Building Regulations 1991 shall be provided between the commercial pan of the premises and house.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of the adjacent occupiers. | Details of refuse storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:	To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. | Details of car parking provision and pedestrian access in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any works commence on site.  Such provision to be brought into use prior to the first occupation of any part of the development permitted and retained permanently.  REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking and pedestrians within the site.
